title: Improve page speed by optimizing your images
content:
Unoptimized images can really hurt your site speed rankings on google. Lets say you have a small 150x150 header logo, but your developer saved it as 1000x1000 and it's just being shrunk to 150 in the browser.  That's a whole lot of wasted Kb the browser has to download. In a nutshell, just size them properly and send the actual images through a [lossless compressor](https://www.google.com/search?q=online+image+compressor)

If you use icons anywhere they should be [sprited](https://www.tutorialrepublic.com/css-tutorial/css-sprites.php) so it's a single image downloaded. 

Your logo should ideally be part of that sprite or an SVG.  SVG is optimal because it's quality infinitely scales.

Tools like Google's [Page Speed Insights] (https://developers.google.com/speed/pagespeed/insights/) should be able to tell you when you have bad images on your page.
seoDescription: One of the reasons your page might be taking too long to load is the images are too large or not optimized for web; check this out.
